page.title: 17 Leisure in Lamberhurst
page.content: The{children}of the village have a large number of places in which to play. There are many{footpaths}and a large{playing field. { Lamberhurst has}grown around the point where the main road crosses the River Teise. The river rises near Tunbridge Wells and joins the River Medway at Yalding.{Fishermen}of all ages regularly try to catch the perch, trout, minnow, roach, rudd, dace, chubb, bream and pike. One tale says that there is a crafty old pike in Mill Bay with five hooks in its mouth. Hills rise steeply from the valley and one of them,{The Mount,}is a favourite place for sledging in the snow. Children of all ages climb up and run down, and cyclists and motorcyclists try out their stunts.
